forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy. Low around 43, with temperatures rising to around 45 overnight. North wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. North northwest wind 2 to 7 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn unfurls its cool embrace over Downtown San Francisco, the city prepares for a day that rests lightly between the crisp promises of winter and the lingering warmth of autumn. Overnight, the clouds have danced lightly across the sky, leaving behind a low temperature that whispers of the season — around 43 degrees, though one may feel a gentle rise as the hours progress towards the day ahead. With the sun expected to make a modest appearance, a high of 54 degrees marks Tuesday, but with temperatures dipping slightly by afternoon, it may be prudent to keep a light layer close at hand.

This morning reveals a cityscape that likely sits under a gentle veil of clarity, devoid of the dense fog that sometimes blankets the area. The unmistakable silhouettes of landmarks like the Golden Gate Bridge stand resolute against a backdrop softened by early morning light, while the breath of the bay gently stirs the air, augmented by a light breeze from the north-northwest. For anyone choosing to venture out, comfortable, layered attire would serve well — perhaps a wool sweater to toast against the chill, complemented by an outdoor jacket for those moments when the wind picks up. Whether it’s a stroll along the Embarcadero to savor a warm cup of coffee or a thoughtful visit to a local gallery, the understated beauty of this day calls for quiet enjoyment. Settle into these moments, allowing the serene ambiance to seep into the soul as the day unfolds gently around you.
